answers.answer: Deb honestly being induced isn't that bad. I had started ctx but as soon as they broke my water everything stopped so i ended up with pit. I wish you the best and can't wait to hear from you.
Deb,The pill is called Cytotec.  I wrote a bit about methods of induction in a previous post called Inducing On Sunday by Jennimom.I wish you the best of luck!  Can't believe it's almost time!

how exciting!now, what's the name going to be?????? the pitocin is not bad as long as you have an epidural. do you plan on one? at least you know when your little one will be here. do not be terrified! it really is not bad. i had all sort of terrifying thoughts going through my mind with my first one and none of them were so! :)

Congrats Debra!!  I have type 2 diabetes (not gestational) and when I was pregnant I also had to be induced with pitosin 3 days before my due date.  It was my first pregnancy so I was also scared.  But it was a piece of cake!  It took 4 hours from the time my dr started me on the pitosin to actually holding my baby in my arms.  Just 4 hours!!  And only 20 minutes of pushing!!  I had a big healthy baby girl (9lbs 2oz, 21 1/4 inches).  And I did it all with out pain medicine...no epidural...so she was very alert when she was born...her eyes were huge and wide open the second she came out.  I had heard all the horror stories about how pitosin makes contractions very painful, but that wasn't true for me.  The only time the contractions were bad was right at the end when I was about 8 or 9 centimeters dialated, then it was time to push.  So I hope your labor and delivery is just as good!  Congrats again!  Oh, one other thing, I was afraid my diabetes would affect my baby but she was fine....she stayed in the room with me the whole time and didn't have to go to the neonatal icu.  Anyway congrats again and good luck with your new baby!!!!!

Big Mac and a Large Fry on its way!!!(no more diabetes)Its actually nice to know when they are coming you can plan a little bit...The way I figure it if it was half as bad as some say then NO women would have 2 or more kids!!Good luck cant wait to hear your story and how Logan arrived

Thanks so much! I am nervous as hell, but your stories are all helpful. I am going to try to do without the epidural, but if it's taking a while and I'm in tremendous pain I will have it.Christie, I had read your post and you didn't have great things to say about that pill. He said he would want it to dilate me enough so he can break my water and go from there. I so hope that's all I need, but at this point, I'll do whatever. It's nice to hear all the good stories about induction. All I've heard is the bad. I will keep you guys posted as to Logan Gage's arrival. Thanks for all the well wishes. And if he decides to make his entrance earlier, I will definitely let you all know. It's amazing to believe that by next week I'll finally get to meet him!Debra :o)

Juts wanted to wish you the best of luck. I was induced with my baby girl... I was 9 days past due. They didnt induce me with a lil pill. I was already 2cm dilated. So they just started me on pit. But they tried for 2 days and i never got into a good labor pattern. I only went to 2 1/2 cm and 65% thinned out. They babys head never came down at all. So we decided the best thing to do was have a c-section. Because the doc didnt think the babys head would come down so i said ok. And thats what they did. I was relly disappionted that i didnt get to have a natural delivery. But i am just happy to have my beautilful baby girl here with me happpy and healthy.... I wish they would have giving me the pill like they are going to you because it seems like it works better.. One of my friends was induced that way and she did relly great... Just wanted to wish you the best... Let us know how it gos.. Best wishes for an easy labor and delivery...Dawnna

Oh, I will take the epi if I need it! The whole thing is so overwhelming to think about. I know you forget about the pain after, but before it is SCARY! But you are right, it's all about looking into that sweet little face that I've waited all this time to see. But I'm glad I'm only doing this once :o)

I was induced with both my kids, and although not ideal births, everything went fairly smoothly.  I was induced due to post dates with both.   I had epidural with both only because I was afraid of contractions with pitocin!  They look after you so well when you are in labour - everything is closely monitored and the likelihood is everything will go well.  Who knows, your little guy might decide to make his entrance before next week. Either way, I hope you get a bit of enjoyment from the experience.  Overall, it is so awesome, despite the pain and worry.Good Luck(I don't post much anymore - my youngest is six months old)

and when you look at that little face you will never be more proud in your entire life. you will feel nothing but pure joy and any pain you had will be long gone. and kudo's to you for going without the epi but not this gal. i have a high tolerence for pain but not for that sort of pain! someone commented above how they did not have the epi and their baby was very alert and bright eyed. i have read where an epi can cause the baby to not be very alert but i had one with all three of mine and they were screaming their little heads off when they came into this world and very alert and looking around. so if you feel like you need it i would not fret over getting it. i am so excited for you :) all the gangs little ones are arriving!

I was induced for my first and it was FINE. I had some 'cream' that was inserted and then I was told to 'go home or shopping' and come back in 5 hours.  I started having some contractions and when I went back 5 hours later they said I was still only slightly dialated, so they sent me off again for another hour (Downtown Toronto-- went to the big shopping mall and wandered... stopping every now and then for contractions)When I went back again they admitted me and then later broke my water. It was really not bad at all!  Best wishes to you.

Thank you so much for the well wishes. I'm trying to stay positive and just concentrate on the end result, finally having my baby. You guys are all so great to share your stories and offer support. I will fill you all in as soon as I can.Hugs,Debra

question: I saw my dr. this a.m. My cervix is soft, but no dilation yet (I'm 39 weeks). He doesn't feel I will go on my own by my due date (5/30), so with the gestational diabetes, they don't let you go much past your due date. I will be scheduled to go to the hospital either Tues (5/31) or Wed (6/1) to give me a little pill you insert into your vagina that will hopefully enable him to break my water. If not, it's pitocin but he said that's his last resort. I'm a bit disappointed as I had pictured what it would be like to just start having contractions and having it happen naturally, but regardless, I should have him next week and that is exciting and terrifying! Just wanted to keep you all posted.Debra :o)
title: Looks like induction :o(
